A Silent Voice:
One Of The Best Movies No Doubt,
very good animation and other
qualities, takes you on a 
rollercoaster of emotions for the 
protagonist. 

Very Good Watch
Dragon Ball Super:
One Of The Best Anime I have Ever
Watched, Ngl the story maybe 
simple but nothing like a good old 
goku screaming and unlocking a 
new hair color (not sarcastic).

Also even though I can't pinpoint
it but may have been my first anime 
I have ever watched which well
got me into anime.

(I know you are not supposed to 
start with Super in the Db universe)
Dragon Ball Z:
Ah yes. the OG. I cannot even begin
so I am not gonna. Yup that's it,
also one other thing. If you find
anyone who doesn't like this
masterpiece, then well my 
advice is that well, ..... commit 
some war crimes (jk lol)
Fuuka:
It is the continuiation of the anime
Suzuka, and compared to Suzuka
this came out recently (well atleast
when I am writing this description).

A good story and good animation
but not what you may call 
exceptional or anything.

A good watch in my eyes, really 
brings out your youth you can say.
Hello World:
Ngl they kind of took the matrix idea
and scaled it a couple of times. 
But I don't wanna give any spoilers.

If you like surprises then this is for you. That's all.
Josee, the Tiger and the Fish:
Just awesome, pure cinema. 
I wanna make a time machine
and go to a time when I didn't watch this masterpiece so that I can
experience it again.

Very good romantic story as well.
Lookism:
Ah yes the anime with most 
resemblance to modern world.
Nah I'm joking, but seriously though
what do these mangakas think 
real world high school is like?

I mean it feels like a war if anything
, and before you say it. I know 
nobody gaf cause it "imagination" 
and not real, but still man.
Midori Days:
A niche anime, I watched cause I
saw a clip on shorts.

That's about it, want more sauce?
Then watch it yourself.
Momotaro The Undefeated:
Look I was searching for an anime
called
Undeafeared Bahamut Chronicle
and since this came up and 
I looked at the release date. I just 
has to watch one of the most 
earliest works of animation.
It's history man.
Monthly Girls - Nozaki-Kun:
Reallly, reallly, really good. 
I wish I could watch it again from a 
time when I didn't know the story.

10/10 must watch in my opinion.
My Dress Up Darling:
Still Waiting for season 2.

Very modern animation, if you 
asked me to give you an example
of any modern animation
I would give this anime as an
example.
My Hero Acadamia:
I mean do I really need to give 
a description for this one.

I liked the story and still do, the 
characters are well written and the
plot makes sense, but its the fans
that disgust me. Shipping evryone,
being cringe. I don't like it.
My Teen Romantic Comedy SNAFU Too:
10/10, that's all I am gonna say, 
don't wanna ruin the story.
One Punch Man:
May Have Been life defining for me.
This anime defined me for 
sometime, saitama vs goku was all 
that was on my mind all day for like a year, but one of the best anime I 
have ever watched hands down.

(Saitama Solos though)
Scissor Seven:
This Anime Cannot Get Enough 
#underrated tag. That's all I am 
gonna say. Just watch it man, 
total cinema, masterpiece.
Shikimori is Not Just A Cutie:
This was one ofthe anime's I 
wanted to watch because everyone
else had too.
But If I am being honest with you, I 
don't like femdom in any way.

I am not a mysogynist but it doesn't
make sense. 
I don't man if you like this type of 
story then go for it.
Suzuka:
A very niche anime, I kind of 
wanted a break from well anime
that most people have watched 
but not necessarily main-stream.

I typed in 's' and well I looked for an anime I have never heard of before.

Story was a bit weird but overall
ok I guess. It's really old as well.
But then I guess that's what you get
going away from mainstream.
The Tunnel to Summer, the Exit of Goodby:
Kind of wished some things in the 
ending changed but overall a good
story. Kind of remind of a 
game by chilla's art.
